title: IELTS Writing Task 2
content:
Writing Task 2

Understanding and Analysis

The 5 types of questions:

  1. Opinion (Agree or Disagree)
  2. Discussion (Discuss both view)
  3. Advantages and Disadvantages
  4. Problem/Causes and Solution
  5. Double Question

Question Analysis

When analyzing a question we have to think about 3 things:

  1. Topic
  2. Keywords
  3. Instruction words

Some experts believe that it is better for children to begin a foreign language at primary school rather than secondary school.

Do the advantages of this outweigh the disadvantages?

Think like an examiner!

Task Response Dos

  • Answer the specific question being asked, Not the general topic

  • Make sure your ideas are relevant

  • Fully address each part of the question

  • State your opinion in introduction and use the supporting paragraphs to support this opinion

  • Reiterate your opinion in the conclusion

Task Response Don’ts

  • Spend lots of time on just one part of the question
  • Give very general examples
  • Leave opinion until the last sentence
  • Repeat the same points over and over
  • Write under 250 words

Coherence and Cohesion Dos

  • Use four paragraph structure
  • Outline your main ideas and opinion in the introduction
  • Have clear topic sentences in your supporting paragraphs
  • Skip a line between paragraphs
  • Use cohesive devices appropriately and accurately

Coherence and Cohesion Don’ts

  • Include background statement in the introduction
  • Have lots of ideas in one paragraph
  • Use cohesive devices at the start of every sentence
  • Use cohesive devices inaccurately

Vocabulary Dos

  • Be careful with spelling ad grammar
  • Be aware of collocations (match the words)
  • Use ‘less-common’ words (specific description)
  • Use topic specific words
  • Follow the 100% rule

Vocabulary Don’ts

  • Repeat the same words again and again
  • Force complex words into your essay without knowing them 100%
  • Use synonyms that are wrong
  • Learn lists of ‘academic’ words out of context

Grammar Dos

  • Try to write as many error-free sentences as possible
  • Use ‘complex’ sentences (two classes rather than single)
  • Use a variety of structures
  • Check work when writing and at the end
  • Follow the 100% rule

Grammar Don’ts

  • Try to use as many different structures as possible
  • Try to impress the examiner with complex grammar
  • Write sentences that stop meaning being conveyed

CLEARITY IS KING

Planning

Generate ideas

6 Questions

  • Who? What? Why? Where? How? When?

Bonus Idea Generation

  • If you asked 100 people, what would be the common answer?
  • If you were trying to win an argument, what idea would you use?

Structure Planning

Introduction

  • Paraphrase Question

  • Outline

Supporting Paragraph 1

  • Main point
  • Explanation
  • Example

Supporting Paragraph 2

  • Main point
  • Explanation
  • Example

Conclusion

  • Summarize main points

Pre-think Vocabulary (Synonyms)

  • Students = graduates = undergraduates
  • University = College = third-level education = tertiary education
  • Consume = use
  • People = human
  • Teenagers = adolescents
  • Governments = States
  • Advantages = benefits

Timing

  • 40 minutes to complete task2
  • 10 minutes planning
  • Most essays are around 12 sentences long
  • 2 minutes per sentence = 24 minutes
  • 6 minutes reviewing and checking our work

Introduction

Common Mistake

  • Writing long general background statements or hooks
  • No opinion or outline of main ideas

Combining opinion and outline

The continued rise in the world’s population is the greatest threat faced by humanity at the present time.

Do you agree?

  • run out of resources
  • damage to the planet

Increasing overpopulation is the biggest thread human beings face today. This essay totally agrees with this statement because this will lead to a serious depletion of resources and pollution

Examples

Opinion

In some countries an increasing number of people are suffering from health problems as a result of
eating too much fast food. It is therefore necessary for governments to impose a higher tax on this kind of food.

Do you agree?

It is argued that states should charge fast food companies more tax because of the growing amount of men and women with health conditions associated with this type of food. This essay totally agrees with that statement because these illnesses cost the health service too much money and increasing the price of junk food would reduce the demand for it.

Discussion

Some people work for the same organisation all their working life.Others think that it is better to work for different organisations.

Discuss both views and give your own opinion.

Some say that it is more beneficial to be employed with the same company all their lives, while others would argue that it is better to work for a variety of companies. This essay will argue that although working for just one employer gives you more financial and other benefits,working at lots of different places provides an employee with more experience.

Advantages and Disadvantages

One of the consequences of improved medical care is that people are living longer and life expectancy is increasing.

Do you think the advantages of this development outweigh the disadvantages?

One of the results of modern medicine is that men and women are able to live longer. This essay will argue that despite the strain this might cause on the pension system,the alleviation of suffering means that the advantages far outweigh the drawbacks.

Problem and Solution

Smartphones are becoming a common sight in the primary school classroom.

What problem does this cause and what is a viable solution?

iPhones and other devices are being used more often by primary school children. This essay will suggest that they are very distracting and that the best solution is to ban them completely in class.

Double Questions

Car ownership has increased so rapidly over the past thirty years that many cities in the world are now ‘one big traffic jam’.

How true do you think this statement is?

What can governments do to discourage people from using their cars?

Lots of city centers are highly congested due to an increase in the ownership of cars in the last three decades. This essay will argue that this is true only during peak times and that improving public transport will reduce this.

Body paragraphs

Common Mistake

  • Too many ideas
  • Undeveloped ideas
  • No/Poor explanations or examples
  • Firstly, secondly, thirdly, finally
  • Poor grammar and vocabulary

Checklist

  • Relevant ideas
  • Fully address all parts of the task
  • Clear position throughout
  • Fully extended and well supported ideas

Structure - 3 Key Elements

  • Topic Sentence
  • Explanation Sentences
  • Example

It is argued that states should charge fast food companies more tax because of the growing amount of men and women with health conditions associated with this type of food. This essay totally agrees with that statement because these illnesses cost the health service too much money and increasing the price of junk food would reduce the demand for it.

Obesity related illnesses cost the taxpayer billions of dollars every year. People who eat too much Food are more likely to suffer from costly diseases associated with being overweight. As a result, they have to go to hospital more regularly for treatment and this puts a strain on the health service. For example,a large proportion of the United Kingdom’s National Health Service budget is spent on preventable, obesity-related diseases, such as heart disease, hypertension and diabetes.

Topic Sentence

  • Short clear statement about what the paragraph is about
  • Directly answers the question
  • Not much detail.
  • Makes your main ideas clear
  • Can’t write one unless you have clear ideas already

Introduction:

increasing the price of junk food would reduce the demand for it.

↓

Topic Sentence:

Another reason why fast food restaurants should pay extra tax is to raise the cost in order to decrease demand.

Explanation

  • Pretend that you are writing to someone with on knowledge of the subject

  • Clear explain

    • what you topic sentence means

    • how it answers the question

    • what the result is

  • Should be around 2-4 sentences

  • Useful language

    • That is to say… = In other words…
    • This is because… = The reason is…
    • As a result… = Therefore…

Another reason why fast food restaurants should pay extra tax is to raise the cost in order to decrease demand. Any extra tax would be added to the normal price of the food, and as prices go up fewer people will be able to afford to buy fatty food. Therefore, this would reduce the amount of junk food people eat and the result would be a healthier nation.

Examples

Better Examples

  • Real examples
  • Converting personal examples

How to think of examples

  • Take examples from your own life experience

  • Convert them into more general examples

  • Think about

    • Where are you form?
    • Where do you live
    • What is your job?
    • What about your family and friends?

Personal:

For example, I used to smoke 20 cigarettes everyday, but the government kept increasing the tax and now I can’t afford to smoke.

↓

General:

For example, when the duty on cigarettes is raised each year in the UK, more people quit smoking and this has a knock on effect on the number of people dying from lung cancer and other smoking related diseases.

Your own personal experience:

My sister’s bookshop closed down because it couldn’t compete with Amazon.

↓

General:

For instance, many bookshops in the UK closed down because of competition from online.

Your own personal experience:

I can’t afford to buy a laptop for my child.

↓

General:

For example, in Ireland laptops are very expensive which would prevent most parents from being able to purchase them for their children.

Conclusion

Big Mistakes

  • New ideas

  • Trying to be entertaining

  • Being too vague

  • Repeating exactly the same thing as in the rest of your essay

  • Using the wrong cohesive devices

Why are conclusions important?

  • It is the last thing the examiner reads
  • It shows the examiner that you can summarise
  • Opinion is clear the whole way through
  • Makes essay cohesive and coherent

Appropriate Cohesive Devices

  • In conclusion,
  • To conclude,

Structure

  • Two essential things are

    • Summary of main points
    • Opinion

  • One sentences

Example

Question:

The continued rise in the world’s population is the greatest threat faced by humanity at the present time. Do you agree?

Introduction:

Increasing overpopulation is the biggest threat human beings face today. This essay totally agrees with this statement because this will lead to a serious depletion of resources and pollution.

Conclusion:

In conclusion, there are too many people in the world and this is a huge threat to everyone because
essential resources are running out and we are also polluting our planet.

Introduction:

iPhones and other devices are being used more often by primary school children. This essay will
suggest that they are very distracting and that the best solution is to ban them completely in class.

Conclusion:

In conclusion, mobiles are not a good idea for young children because they interfere with the learning process and this should be stopped by telling parents that they are not allowed in schools.

Review

  • Grammar

    • Prepositions
    • Articles
    • Verb-subject agreement
    • Countable/Uncountable nouns
    • Tenses
    • Capital letters

  • Vocabulary

    First you should scan for any words repeated that you can easily change using synonyms.

    Focus on

    • Collocations
    • Meaning
    • Spelling
    • Word form

  • Checklist

    • Does the essay answer all parts of the question?
    • Is the opinion clear in the introduction?
    • Does each supporting paragraph have a clear topic sentence?
    • Are ideas fully developed with explanations and examples?
    • Is your opinion clear throughout the whole essay?
    • Is there a suitable conclusion?
    • Over 250 words?
    • Range of complex and simple sentences.
    • Anything confusing or unclear?

1. Opinion

Question

  • Do you agree or disagree?
  • To what extent do you agree or disagree
    • always state ‘strongly agree’ or ‘strongly disagree’

Alternative wording of opinion questions

  • Is this a positive or negative development?
  • To what extent is this a positive or negative development

Common Mistakes

  • Not giving your opinion
  • Leaving opinion until the conclusion
  • Discussing someone else’s opinion
  • Discussing both sides of the argument

Band 9 Checklist

  • Give a clear opinion in the introduction
  • Think of two main points supporting your opinion
  • Develop these main points with explanations and examples
  • Short conclusion summarizing your main points and reiterating your opinion

Deciding Opinion

  • Wastes time
  • Personal opinion does not matter
  • Pick one side only
  • Pick the side you can easily write about

Language

Good in introduction:

  • This essay completely agrees that…
  • This essay totally disagrees that…
  • In my opinion,
  • I totally agree/disagree

Structure

Paragraph Introduction

  • Paraphrase Question
  • Give opinion and outline main points

Supporting Paragraph I

  • Topic Sentence
  • Explanations
  • Example

Supporting Paragraph II

  • Topic Sentence
  • Explanations
  • Example

Conclusion

  • Summary

Planning- Idea Generation

In many countries it is now illegal to advertise alcohol. Do you agree or disagree?

Thoughts:

  • Why do I agree? (Coffee shop method)

  • Alcohol is a problem both socially and for our health

  • Taking advantage of alcoholics

  • Advertisers can influence people to drink alcohol

  • Young people are exposed to persuasive ads

Introduction

  • Paraphrase Question
  • Agree and outline main points

Supporting Paragraph 1

  • Topic Sentence - health and social problems
  • Explanations - addiction and bad behaviour
  • Example - Russia

Supporting Paragraph 2

  • Topic Sentence - influence
  • Explanations - glamorise and young people
  • Example - Specific advert

Conclusion

  • Summary

Vocabulary:

  • Illegal-banned, ban, prohibited, not allowed.
  • Advertise-TV, radio, print, ads, commercials, promoting.
  • Alcohol-drinking, alcoholic drinks/beverages,beer, wine and spirits.
  • Addiction-alcoholic, addicted to alcohol, alcohol dependence, dependent on alcohol.
  • Bad behavior -anti-social behavior, violence,vandalism.
  • Influence-sway,persuade,convince.

More and more people are now working remotely from home. Is this a positive or negative development?

Introduction

  • Paraphrase Question
  • Positive and outline main points

Supporting Paragraph 1

  • Topic Sentence - less stress
  • Explanations - no commute in heavy traffic / timeable adaptable to personal needs
  • Example - workers can make timetable to incorporate regular breaks in order to relax

Supporting Paragraph 2

  • Topic Sentence - less environmental impact
  • Explanations - lower carbon footprint due to less travel and energy to power office buildings
  • Example - Pandemic meant working from home, which meant lower levels of pollution

Conclusion

  • Summary

Review

  • Now don’t forget to review your essay
  • Make sure that:
    • Give a clear opinion in the introduction
    • Think of two main points supporting your opinion
    • Develop these main points with explanations and examples
    • Short conclusion summarizing your main points and reiterating your opinion
